item.description:
Presented by the Boston Portuguese Festival

http://www.bostonportuguesefestival.org/

http://www.artsboston.org/event/detail/441592123

Â 

The Boston Portuguese Festival and the Azorean Maritime Heritage Society are hosting its 7th Annual Azorean Whale Boat Regatta at the MIT Pierce Boathouse, on Sunday, June 03, 2012.

The annual regatta, one of the most celebrated events of the Boston Portuguese Festival, is back this year with more crews competing and a great program.

Races will begin at 1pm and spectators can root for their local teams from the viewing deck of the MIT Pierce Boathouse overlooking the Charles River. About 10 teams, comprised of 7 rowers compete for the first, second and third prize in these unique whaleboats owned and maintained by the Azorean Maritime Heritage Society. The event is open to the public and admission is free. In addition to the races, there will be a whaleboat sailing demonstration, including tours on the boats, an awards ceremony for crews competing and an opportunity to listen to some of the rich oral history behind whaling.

This will be a joint Meetup event with the Boston Culture Club

http://www.meetup.com/Boston-Culture-Club/

If you are a member of both groups, for accurate attendance count, please only reserve "yes" under one group. Thank you.
item.how_to_find_us: At the entrance of the MIT Boat House

group.name: The Boston/Cambridge Portuguese Language Meetup Group

item.name: Lets watch the Azorean Whaleboat Regatta! on the Charles River!
